ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: After taking this course, I developed the ability to speak in a small group setting confidently, and learn the finer points of strengthening an argument.
I have learned how to better compose and edit essays on difficult and abstract topics.
I developed my writing skills extensively especially in terms of formatting with respect to MLA style and writing research papers.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths would be the number of assignments and the objectives they were designed to meet. Each paper had a purpose, and through the completion of each, my writing skills benefited greatly.
The course does a great job at tailoring each student's needs in order to help him/her improve as a writer.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I definitely recommend this course, because of the readings that have the ability to change your perspective of what vision is, and the pleasant conversations that sprout during this seminar.

Before you take the course, think very carefully about the topic and whether you would be interested in getting into deep discussions/thinking about it. Once you know that you would be genuinely interested in exploring sight and insight, definitely take this course! Professor Carlisle provides you with time and space to think in and out of the classroom, and I found this course very supportive of my learning college writing as a freshman here. Also, some of the readings and discussions gave me perspectives that I cherish very much.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Especially is they feel nervous about writing in college. This course is a good way to develop your critical writing skills and give yourself space to experiment a bit if you are unsure of your writing ability.
